poem:
### The Contradiction of Plate and Prejudice  

Inside the Rose Goute Creole,
laughter rises like steam,
Sous chefs dance to an old rhythm—
seasoned pots, not pots of trouble.
Outside, the line stretches,
a testament to hunger
more honest than fear—
savoring stories folded
into the kind of meal
that doesn't need words
to say family.
